repository_info.description: Free Auto GPT with NO paids API is a repository that offers a simple version of Auto GPT, an autonomous AI agent capable of performing tasks independently. Unlike other versions, our implementation do

issues.title: Run with Local LLM Models
issues.body:
We tried many local models like LLAMA, VICUNA, OPENASSIST, GPT4ALL in their 7b versions. None seem to give results like the CHATGPT API. 

we would like to try to test new models, which can be loaded in a maximum of 16gm of RAM, to allow accessibility to anyone without discrimination. 

Any advice for LLM models with fine tuning for high performance instructions?
issues.author: IntelligenzaArtificiale

comments.author: wingeva1986
comments.body: Does this project support third-party OpenAI interfaces (such as poe.com)? If it does, are there any other requirements for these interfaces, such as message format, context memory, and number of conversations?

issues.title: We need help to run on Colab
issues.body:
### We have a problem when try to run new solution on colab . 


**Open the colab and try to resolve error** [![Open in Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/assets/colab-badge.svg)](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1PvDORq_LoF90xXQyiMDgdHm1KXUQMwo5?usp=sharing)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108482353/235515553-7486ee5c-55d9-4fb0-92b2-5a92f8b9d0bd.png)

It seems that openAI doesn't like requests from colab servers :(

Does anyone know how to bypass the problem?

**Please help us to democratize AI**
issues.author: IntelligenzaArtificiale

issues.title: AUTOGPT model attempts to write a file but no success
issues.body:
I tried asking autogpt to create a sample.py that prints "Hello" and then let it run for about an hour.

it kept trying to write the file using write\_file. There was time it thought it had created the file successfully and then attempted to write the file or search the internet on how to write a python file again.

It was stuck in the loop.... 'attempting to write the file' --->'thinking it has written a file successfully' --->'search the internet'--->'back to writing the file again'

I use Docker/Visual Studio Code to run the script.
issues.author: averagenewbie2023

comments.author: IntelligenzaArtificiale

issues.title: BING CHAT has too many limitations and ethics
issues.body:
We have recently implemented the BING CHAT API. 

The problem is that unlike ChatGPT it refuses to perform tasks, or to play role-playing games. 

With AUTOGPT.PY he sometimes works very well, almost scary, other times he refuses to perform tasks (such as writing articles or other tasks that he deems not suitable for him) 

Instead on BabyAGI and Camel , it refuses to perform the tasks. Because they are based on role-playing PromptTemplate . And bingchat is set to not execute these role-play task.

Any suggestions to buy pass the problem?
issues.author: IntelligenzaArtificiale

comments.author: mithras666
comments.body:
Hmm, I've heard that Bing reacts negatively to messages with accusative/imperative tone (Using "you must" or "do this"). 

I wonder if we could add some sort of randomized jailbreak prompt to the default Bing prompts. 

Be careful with that though because Microsoft is banning people for using th

issues.title: Question about Creating and Managing Conversations
issues.body:
Hello,

I have a few questions about how to properly use the chat functionality in the `revChatGPT` package.

1. **Creating a New Chat:** I am looking to create a new chat and ensure that the conversation stays within this specific chat session. I noticed that there's a `conversation_id` argument when initializing the `Chatbot` class, but I'm not entirely clear on how to use it. Could you provide an example or further explanation on how to create a new chat and keep the conversation within that particular chat session?

2. **Managing Existing Chats:** Additionally, I would like to know how to retrieve a list of existing conversations and how to join an existing conversation. Is there a method to fetch all active `conversation_id`s? And once I have a `conversation_id`, how can I join that conversation and continue the chat?

Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance!
issues.author: epodak

from FreeLLM import ChatGPTAPI

issues.title: Loop e non salvataggio di file in AutoGPT
issues.body:
Ciao.
Come vedi dal titolo ci sono due problemi che sto riscontrando:
1- A volte quando deve cercare delle cose utilizzando Duck Search, va in loop cercando sempre le stesse cose. Probabilmente √® dovuto al modello o all'implementazione di OpenAI.
2- Quando deve scrivere dei file, non riesce. Prima mi ha anche detto che non ha i permessi necessari per farlo. Questo probabilmente √® dovuto all'integrazione in Windows (non sono sicuro).

Ho cercato di provare in vari modi, creando anche un'immagine Docker e mettendo il tutto l√¨ dentro ma niente. Se avete dei suggerimenti, lo apprezzerei davvero.
issues.author: FlamingFury00

comments.author: FlamingFury00
comments.body: Ciao di nuovo, ho trovato l'errore e l'ho sistemato per il fatto dei file. Ora far√≤ una push request se ti va bene.

comments.author: FlamingFury00
comments.body: Ho creato la pull request. Il problema del loop c'√® ancora, perci√≤ lascer√≤ aperto l'issue. Il problema sembrerebbe essere la creazione di pi√π istanze di chat su OpenAI, facendo ricominciare daccapo il "ragionamento" del modello.

Grazie ancora davvero per

issues.body:
Hey man thank you verry much for doing this project.
I did everything to set it up and installed requirements, but if i try to do teh same like you on in the sample video, i get the following error:

KeyError: 'message'
Traceback:
File "C:\Users\Christian\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python311\Lib\site-packages\streamlit\runtime\scriptrunner\script_runner.py", line 565, in _run_script
